macro_markets.query: What are the most important macroeconomic and stock market news and developments from the past 24 hours? Include major index movements, Fed/central bank news, and significant company earnings or announcements.

items.title: Dow Jones Breaks 50,000 Milestone as Markets Rebound
items.summary: The Dow Jones Industrial Average surpassed 50,000 for the first time on Friday, February 6, driven by a rebound in technology and chip stocks following a volatile week. The index closed the Monday session flat at 50,135.87, while the S&P 500 rose 0.5% to 6,964.82 and the Nasdaq gained 0.9% to 23,238.67.

items.title: Tech Stocks Lead Recovery in 'Debasement Trade' Session
items.summary: Technology stocks, commodities, and major currencies rebounded Monday as markets benefited from a US Dollar sell-off. Nvidia rose 2.4%, Broadcom gained 3.3%, and the Nasdaq led US indexes for the first time since January 28, signaling mean-reversion flows ahead of key economic data.

items.title: Gold Reaches $5,100 Amid Safe-Haven Demand
items.summary: Gold rebounded to $5,100 ahead of key economic data releases, supported by safe-haven bids and recent Chinese gold accumulation. The bullion must push above this level to maintain momentum.

items.title: Retail Sales and Employment Cost Index Set as Key Risk Events
items.summary: US markets face critical economic data Tuesday with Retail Sales and Employment Cost Index releases, both crucial for inflation-growth dynamics and Fed expectations. Hawkish Fed voters Hammack and Logan could amplify market reactions to the data.

items.title: Hims & Hers Plunges 16% Following Novo Nordisk Lawsuit
items.summary: Hims & Hers stock sank 16% after Novo Nordisk filed a lawsuit alleging unlawful sales of weight-loss treatment copies. The action follows FDA restrictions on ingredients needed to replicate popular weight-loss medications.

items.title: Transocean to Acquire Valaris in $5.8 Billion All-Stock Deal
items.summary: Offshore drilling company Transocean announced plans to acquire Valaris in an all-stock transaction valued at $5.8 billion. Valaris shares leaped 34.3% on the announcement, while Transocean reversed early losses to rise 5.9%.

items.title: Kroger Climbs 3.9% After Naming Former Walmart Executive as CEO
items.summary: Kroger stock rose 3.9% following the grocer's announcement of a new chief executive from Walmart, signaling investor confidence in the leadership transition.

crypto_news.query: What are the most significant cryptocurrency and blockchain news from the past 24 hours? Include major price movements, regulatory news, and notable project developments.

items.title: Bitcoin Rebounds Above $65,000 After Largest Weekly Drop Since 2022
items.summary: Bitcoin climbed back above $65,000 on Friday despite a nearly 14% weekly decline, the worst since November 2022, amid broader market volatility and a $2 trillion loss from the crypto market's October peak. Ether also recovered 4% to $1,921 after hitting a 10-month low.

items.title: Vitalik Buterin Questions Role of Ethereum Layer 2s, Suggests Pivot to Value-Added Services
items.summary: Ethereum co-founder Vitalik Buterin reevaluated the rollup-centric roadmap, noting L2s have decentralized slower than the base layer, and urged them to focus on privacy, fast confirmations, or non-financial uses beyond scaling.

items.title: White House Stablecoin Meeting on Feb. 10 Could Advance CLARITY Act
items.summary: A confirmed White House meeting on stablecoin policy today may resolve disputes over USDC rewards and unfreeze the CLARITY Act, a key crypto market-structure bill stalled in the Senate.

items.title: Bitcoin Trades Near $68,000 After 46% Drawdown from All-Time High
items.summary: Bitcoin hovers around $68,400 following a 50% drop from October 2025 highs, breaking below its 365-day moving average for the first time since 2022, signaling major bearish momentum amid Fed rates and geopolitical tensions.

items.title: Mirae Asset in Talks to Acquire South Korea's Korbit Exchange for $97.5 Million
items.summary: Mirae Asset Financial Group is negotiating to buy Korbit, South Korea's fourth-largest crypto exchange, in a deal worth up to 140 billion won ($97.5 million).

items.title: Crypto Market Suffers Record Losses on AI Fears and Extreme Fear Sentiment
items.summary: Bitcoin saw a record one-day $200 billion market cap wipeout last Thursday, with sentiment hitting FTX-era lows at a Greed and Fear index of 9; crypto treasuries deeply underwater as prices dive.

ai_news.query: What are the most important artificial intelligence and machine learning news and developments from the past 24 hours? Include new model releases, company announcements, research breakthroughs, and industry trends.

items.title: The Great AI Squeeze: Hyperscalers Face Massive Capex Pressures
items.summary: Alphabet, Microsoft, and Amazon are signaling record capital expenditures for AI infrastructure, with Alphabet forecasting up to $185 billion in 2026 capex. Rising memory chip costs are creating supply chain pressures across the broader hardware industry.

items.title: Python 3.15 Shows JIT Compiler Speed Gains; PyTorch 2.10 Released
items.summary: Python 3.15 alphas demonstrated JIT compiler performance improvements of 7-8% on some platforms, while PyTorch 2.10 landed with over 4,160 commits and significant performance enhancements including combo-kernels horizontal fusion and variable length attention support.

items.title: GitHub Copilot SDK Now in Technical Preview
items.summary: GitHub announced the Copilot SDK in technical preview, enabling developers to embed agentic AI capabilities directly into applications with support for Python, Node.js, Go, and .NET.

items.title: AI-Driven Cooling Fluid Research Advances Heat Transfer Technology
items.summary: Researchers published findings on diamond-based nanofluids optimized with machine learning, demonstrating significantly improved heat transfer efficiency for microelectronics and renewable energy systems through AI-integrated computational frameworks.

items.title: AI's Labor Market Impact Remains Limited Despite Targeted Job Cuts
items.summary: Goldman Sachs reports that AI's overall impact on employment remains limited, though specific occupations like marketing, graphic design, customer service, and tech roles face disruption as companies implement AI-driven organizational changes.

items.title: Darveen Showcases Edge AI and Industrial Computing Solutions
items.summary: Industrial computing leader Darveen will demonstrate AI-driven edge intelligence solutions at embedded world 2026, featuring 14th Gen Intel Core computers with GPU support and ARM-based industrial panel PCs for deep learning and machine vision applications.

gaming.query: What are the most notable video game and gaming industry news from the past 24 hours? Include game releases, announcements, esports, and industry developments.

items.title: Overwatch Drops the '2' and Launches Reign of Talon with 10 New Heroes
items.summary: Blizzard has retired the '2' from Overwatch, rebranding it as a single continuously evolving platform rather than a sequel. The Reign of Talon Season 1 launches with 10 new heroes, faster development cycles, and a commitment to handcrafted content over AI-generated material.

items.title: Crisol: Theater of Idols Releases on Multiple Platforms
items.summary: Crisol: Theater of Idols, a first-person action horror game set in a nightmarish environment, launches on PS5, Xbox Series X|S, and PC.

items.title: Sony Announces Extended State of Play Showcase
items.summary: Sony is hosting its first games showcase of 2026 this week, running for more than an hourâ€”one of the longest State of Play events to date.

tech_news.query: What are the most important technology news and developments from the past 24 hours? Include major product launches, company news, and significant tech industry developments. Exclude AI-specific news.
